12:50.race_name: Free Race Replays On attheraces.com Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB) (A-W)

runners.comment: Third of eight in an Irish maiden point; stable gets its fair share of bumper winners
runners.name: Itsinthename
runners.spotlight: Third of eight in an Irish maiden point in October after which he changed hands for £70,000; stable get its fair share of bumper winners; respected, especially if market positive.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Cerdeval Mme Valerie Aumont Mr
runners.comment: Looks the part on breeding and stable has a fine strike-rate in bumpers
runners.name: Le Cold Grey
runners.spotlight: 75,000euros yearling; 95,000euros 3yo; half-brother to winners Gaillard Du Mesnil (1m5f AQPS Flat and high-class 2m4f-3m6f hurdle/chase) and Hardi Du Mesnil (French 2m1f hurdle); dam 1m3f/1m4f AQPS Flat winner, half-sister to useful 2m4f hurdle winner; looks the part on breeding and stable has a fine strike-rate in bumpers.

runners.comment: Third on his Southwell debut in November, but hung markedly up the home straight
runners.name: My Mate AJ
runners.spotlight: Sent off 2-1 favourite when third of 11 on his Southwell debut (2m, soft) in November; clearly has ability and stable has a good record in bumpers, but he hung markedly up the home straight at Southwell which would be a concern on this track.

runners.comment: Has a good Flat pedigree, but stable wouldn't be associated with bumper winners
runners.name: Kings Wardrobe
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns foal; half-brother to 6f/7f winner Mums Tipple (including AW/2yo Listed; RPR 115); dam unplaced 6f-1m (55), half-sister to winners Gwaihir (French 1m 2yo Listed) and Mombassa (useful 5f-9.5f), out of unraced sister to Chester Vase winner; has a good Flat pedigree, but stable wouldn't be associated with bumper winners.

runners.comment: Interesting pedigree and market should be helpful; tongue-tie on
runners.name: Moscow Star
runners.spotlight: 20,000euros yearling; 47,000euros 2yo; half-brother to five winners including Heartbreak City (1m2f-2m Flat, RPR 118; 2m hurdle), Melburnian (10.5f-1m4f Flat, 85; 2m hurdle) and Coquelicot (2m Flat, 86; Listed bumper and 2m4f-3m hurdle); dam French 1m5f winner; interesting pedigree and sports a tongue-tied on debut having undergone wind surgery last summer; market helpful.

runners.comment: Perhaps not as appealing as some on pedigree but stable does well with its bumper runners
runners.name: Broken Vow
runners.spotlight: 7,000gns 3yo; half-sister to four winners including Woodcock Flight (7f/1m including US; RPR 96), Sister Rosetta (5f/6f including AW 2yo; 92) and Butterfly Garden (1m4f; 80); dam 7f-1m1f winner (86), out of sister to 1m4f/12.5f Group 2 winner Sacrament; perhaps not as appealing as some on pedigree, but stable does well with its bumper runners; market crucial.

13:20.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Virgin 519 Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 125-1 and was pulled up in a Wincanton maiden (1m7f, soft) on debut last month
runners.name: Blazing Gaden
runners.spotlight: 125-1 and was pulled up in a Wincanton maiden (1m7f, soft) on debut last month.

runners.comment: Well-held fifth in two bumpers but he shaped with some promise last time; hurdling debut
runners.name: Bluey Bay
runners.spotlight: Out of 2m6f/3m hurdle winner; well-held fifth at big prices in two bumpers but he shaped with some promise at Southwell (good to soft) last month; should have a future at this new discipline but it could be over longer trips later on.

runners.breeder: Mrs L N Harmes & Mr M Willis
runners.comment: Dual AW winner but he's been well held in both hurdle runs; down the list
runners.name: Fravanco
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner but his last success was 16 months ago; runner-up on Polytrack (1m2f/1m4f) in final two runs during the summer but he returned to hurdling with a well-held fifth of seven over C&D (good to soft) last month; still unexposed in this sphere but he has quite a bit to find on the figures and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a point but he's been beaten 25l and 61l in two hurdle runs this autumn
runners.name: Gone Country
runners.spotlight: Out of unraced half-sister to smart hurdler Splendid Thyne; runner-up in Irish point in March but he's been beaten 25l and 61l in his two hurdle runs (2m, good/soft) this autumn; passed over.

runners.comment: Point winner who chased home a 1-14 shot on hurdling debut here last month; in the mix
runners.name: Hello Fortune
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to smart Irish hurdler Impact Factor; won Irish point in October (good to yielding) and he made an encouraging start over hurdles when runner-up behind a 1-14 shot here (2m3f, good to soft) last month; pulled well clear of the third in that race and he's open to more progress on this drop to 2m; in the mix.

runners.comment: Well held in sole bumper but he needs watching in market on this switch to hurdling
runners.name: Holeheartedly
runners.spotlight: Well-held sixth of 12 in Warwick bumper (good to soft; 10-1) last month but that was a decent race and he may have needed the experience; with top yard and he needs watching in market now switched to hurdling on his second start.

runners.comment: Flopped latest but was treated for post-race heat stress; dangerous if he can bounce back
runners.name: Jamada
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner (good to yielding), who was respectable second when odds-on for hurdling/stable debut at Sedgefield (2m, good) in October; flopped at Plumpton the following month but he stopped quickly and was treated for post-race heat stress; still early days in this sphere and has possibilities if he can bounce back.

runners.comment: Fell in last Irish point and now goes hurdling after another lengthy absence; best watched
runners.name: Knight Templar
runners.spotlight: Finished placed on Irish point debut in spring 2024 but he was held when falling on his second start in February; now switches to hurdling after another lengthy absence and he's best watched; hood added.

runners.comment: Flat winner who made a solid start over hurdles when fourth at Huntingdon; not ruled out
runners.name: Sense Of Reason
runners.spotlight: His Flat win was in a Class 6 handicap on AW, but he made a promising start over hurdles when fourth at Huntingdon (2m, soft) last month; was beaten only about 8l and has each-way claims if he can build on that.

runners.breeder: Haras De S A Aga Khan Scea
runners.comment: Fair Flat performer in France but he's struggled in two hurdle runs for current yard
runners.name: Somkiyr
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat performer in France but he's struggled at big prices in two hurdle runs (2m, good to soft) for new yard this winter; hood now added.

runners.comment: Fair fifth on hurdling debut at Wincanton but he may ideally want further in this sphere
runners.name: Trapper John
runners.owner: Andrew McGladdery And Park Lodge Stables
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on the Flat but he went close in 1m6f Catterick handicap (good; RPR 71) in October; made a decent start over hurdles when fifth of 18 at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) last month but he may ideally want further in this sphere and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Turned over at 5-4 at Huntingdon but that was behind a useful rival; possibilities
runners.name: Unjeu Royal
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; had excuse on hurdle debut and, although turned over at 5-4 at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft), the winner went on to finish second to the exciting Old Park Star at Cheltenham before finishing behind in Aintree's Grade 1 on Boxing Day; this gelding faces nothing of his calibre here.

runners.comment: Only narrowly denied at Huntingdon last month and he's open to more progress; respected
runners.name: Wondering Why
runners.spotlight: Joined Ben Pauling for £54,000 after winning a bumper for Richard Bandey; held in two hurdle runs for current yard but he made a bold bid at Huntingdon (2m, soft) last month and was only narrowly denied by his main market rival; that form puts him firmly in the picture and he's open to more progress.

runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D on hurdling debut and had tough task at Kempton latest; shortlisted
runners.name: Zamek
runners.spotlight: Placed in a Chepstow bumper for Paul Nicholls and was creditable second on hurdling/stable debut over C&D (good to soft) in November; failed to build on that at Kempton on Boxing Day but that was behind a smart prospect and he's back in calmer waters here; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Irish point winner but he's struggled in both runs under rules (bumper/hurdle); opposable
runners.name: Connies Hill
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point in May but she's finished tailed off in a bumper and a novice hurdle (2m5f, good to soft) since; opposable.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner who was a promising second on hurdling debut at Newbury; key player
runners.name: Cayman Dancer
runners.spotlight: 2-9 on the Flat for Charlie Johnston, the latter win gained at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW; RPR 81) in October; changed hands for 26,000gns soon afterwards; weak 11-2 shot on hurdling debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) last month but he made steady headway before keeping on well to finish second of ten; that was promising and he sets the standard on that form.

runners.comment: Progressive stayer on the Flat but he was disappointing on hurdling debut last month
runners.name: Kentucky River
runners.owner: J R B Williams & Emdells Limited
runners.spotlight: Progressive on the Flat for Ollie Sangster this summer, culminating in a 7l win at Pontefract (2m1f, good to firm) in August; should make a hurdler but he was disappointing on stable debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month and needs to leave that form well behind; one of two runners for yard.

runners.comment: Poor form in four Flat runs and can only be watched on hurdling debut
runners.name: Shifra
runners.spotlight: Poor form in four Flat runs, including when last of nine in a Brighton handicap (1m, good to soft) in October; can only be watched on hurdling debut.

13:50.race_name: mybettingsites.com Surrey National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made low-key return last month but well handicapped on older form; first run in a marathon
runners.name: Makinyourmindup
runners.spotlight: Made low-key return from long layoff when remote fourth at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) last month but well handicapped on form shown in February/March 2024 and has possibilities on first attempt at a marathon trip.

runners.comment: Clear winner over 3m6f at Exeter last month; latest 7lb rise asks a lot of him
runners.name: Art Decco
runners.spotlight: Showed career-best form when winning by 9l at Exeter (3m6f, soft) last month and is now 6-15 over fences; should be fine on this left-handed track but recent 7lb rise asks quite a lot of him.

runners.comment: Very useful marathon chaser on his day but badly out of form over hurdles this season
runners.name: Surrey Quest
runners.spotlight: Very useful marathon chaser on his day but looked out of sorts in three hurdle races towards end of last year; given another wind operation (his third) since; well handicapped but reverts to chasing with lots to prove.

runners.comment: Good third at Aintree last month and still only 4lb higher than for Welsh National win
runners.name: Val Dancer
runners.spotlight: Bettered underwhelming seasonal debut when placed over the big Aintree fences (3m2f, soft) last month and remains only 4lb higher than when winning last season's Welsh National (3m6f, soft); high on the list.

runners.comment: Placed on last two hurdle starts but his chase run in between was just respectable
runners.name: Whistle Stop Tour
runners.owner: Mrs Jo Tracey K Alexander P&S Bryceland
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over hurdles at Ayr (3m, soft) since cheekpieces were added in November but was just a respectable fifth over fences at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft) in between; might have untapped potential over this new trip but others appeal more.

runners.comment: Won on chasing debut (3m1f); safely held since but still looks interesting over new trip
runners.name: Hidden History
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who rallied to lead close home on seasonal/chase debut at Aintree (3m1f, good to soft) in November; well below that form after racing too freely last month but Dan Skelton is evidently very keen to move him up in trip.

runners.comment: Very inconsistent 9yo; sports first-time cheekpieces on first outing since December 2024
runners.name: Regal Blue
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 9yo who often looks very unenthusiastic; made all in valuable novices' handicap chase at Uttoxeter (3m, heavy) in March 2024 but absent since two lacklustre runs at end of that year; had wind in September and now sports first-time cheekpieces; this first run after a layoff might be a good day to catch him in the right mood, but others are much less risky.

runners.comment: Won first five chases; disappointed last time but may still have more improvement to come
runners.name: Aworkinprogress
runners.spotlight: Launched chasing career with five consecutive wins, the latest on seasonal debut at Uttoxeter (3m2f, heavy) in November; could still have more improvement to come over this new trip but needs to bounce back from last month's disappointing run.

runners.comment: Ran big race before fading into fourth in London National at Sandown last month
runners.name: Invincible Nao
runners.spotlight: Won last season's Sussex National at Plumpton (3m4f, soft); just held on in three-runner race at Sandown (2m4f, good) on seasonal debut and ran big race before fading into fourth in London National there (3m4f, good to soft) last month; enters calculations.

runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.comment: Clear second in Lincolnshire National on Boxing Day; may prefer better ground than this
runners.name: Ivane
runners.spotlight: Four wins since joining this stable last spring, the latest in Durham National at Sedgefield (3m5f, good) in October; arguably posted career-best performance when clear second in Lincolnshire National at Market Rasen (3m3f, good to soft) on Boxing Day but went up another 4lb for that and the forecast slower ground here may not be ideal.

runners.comment: Thorough stayer; not at good as she was but ended last year with some good efforts
runners.name: My Silver Lining
runners.spotlight: Not as good as she was but ended last year with some good efforts, most recently when second in Tommy Whittle at Haydock (3m1f, soft), and this move back up in trip is sure to suit.

runners.comment: Won on chase debut and was placed in Fontwell marathon next time; could have more to offer
runners.name: Ken Roy
runners.spotlight: Ended his novice hurdle season under a cloud but, following a wind operation, returned in the autumn with easy win in three-runner Plumpton chase (3m1f, good) and creditable third in Southern National at Fontwell (3m3f, good to soft); could still have more to offer.

runners.comment: Won this race narrowly in 2025 but well beaten all four starts since
runners.name: Sporting Ace
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with narrow win in this race a year ago (heavy) and is now 1lb below that mark but well beaten all four starts since (three this season) and needs to bounce back again; headgear (worn for last two races) removed.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in 4m Borders National last month and still lightly raced over fences
runners.name: Catch Catchfire
runners.spotlight: Very close third over hurdles on seasonal debut in November and not beaten far from out of the weights in Borders National at Kelso (4m, soft) when back over fences last month; suffered early mishap last time and is 1lb wrong today but, after only six chase runs, he's not fully exposed.

runners.comment: Up in grade after two Southwell wins but looked in rude health last time
runners.name: Ali Star Bert
runners.spotlight: Ended 2025 with two wins at Southwell (3m, soft/good to soft); contests this much stronger race from 3lb out of the weights but he looked in particularly good nick on his latest outing and this trip should be fine.

runners.comment: Ran well before fading into fifth in Windsor marathon yesterday
runners.name: Special John
runners.spotlight: Won Class 5 handicaps at Exeter (3m) and Wincanton (3m2f, also good to soft) when switched to fences in the autumn, and ran very well before fading into fifth in stronger company at Windsor (3m4f, soft) yesterday; will be 3lb wrong if he makes a quick reappearance here, though.

14:20.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Absent since October 2024 but resumes on a good mark; market may guide
runners.name: Canty Bay
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner in 2023-24 season (2m3f/2m5f); absent since respectable fourth at Newton Abbot (2m5f, heavy) in October 2024 but resumes on a good mark; market may guide.

runners.comment: Won a recent seller but faces a much tougher assignment on this handicap return
runners.name: Casa Loupi
runners.spotlight: Bounced back from disappointing seasonal debut with clear win in Leicester seller (2m4f, soft) three weeks ago but faces much tougher task on this handicap return and still has something to prove; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Step back in right direction when fourth last month (2m); interesting over new trip here
runners.name: Galactic Charm
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on first two starts this season but his keeping-on fourth at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) last month was a big step back in the right direction and he looks interesting over this new trip.

runners.comment: Chasing hasn't gone to plan this season but he reverts to hurdling on a workable mark
runners.name: Chief Sunday
runners.spotlight: Dual 2m hurdle winner last season (both on soft ground); chasing hasn't gone to plan this term (three attempts) but he reverts to hurdling on a workable mark and could still have untapped potential at around 2m4f.

runners.comment: Fell in a chase last time but hurdling is more her game and she's on a good mark now
runners.name: Sunday Soldier
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in two chases in the autumn; fell when last in action and now reverts to hurdling but this is more her game and she's on a good mark; will be suited by today's trip/ground; might be the answer.

runners.breeder: Mrs Marie Merienne & Mr Julien Merienne
runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles last season; flopped on reappearance but may still have potential
runners.name: Confinentic
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 5yo who had 2-3 strike-rate over hurdles last season, the latter win gained on handicap debut at Plumpton (2m4f, soft) last February; dropped out very tamely on last month's reappearance but may still have potential if back on song.

runners.comment: Unlucky to come to grief mid-race on last month's handicap debut and remains unexposed
runners.name: Sea Warrior
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 7yo who displayed clear promise in three novice/maiden hurdles (2m-2m3f); unlucky to come to grief mid-race on last month's handicap debut and remains unexposed.

runners.comment: Maiden winner last February but yet to build on that performance after three handicap runs
runners.name: Karton Plein
runners.spotlight: Made all in Southwell maiden (2m, good to soft) last February but unable to build on that performance in three autumn handicaps (2m-2m4f), albeit his penultimate run was fairly good; reportedly not suited by soft, heavy in places ground when pulled up last time; has a point to prove.

runners.comment: Struggled on last month's reappearance outing but was a C&D winner last season
runners.name: Godot
runners.owner: A Lewers D Shaw A Irvine
runners.spotlight: Looked out of sorts when pulled up on last month's seasonal debut at Ascot but is now only 1lb higher than when winning over C&D (soft) in December 2024 and can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Fourth over 2m in both hurdle races; up in trip for handicap debut; improvement likely
runners.name: Blue Sky Dreaming
runners.spotlight: Displayed promise on last season's bumper debut and when fourth in two 2m hurdles in the autumn; untested on ground slower than good to soft but should have some improvement to come in handicaps and this step up in trip is likely to suit.

runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles; bumped into a big improver when second of four last time; new trip today
runners.name: Risk It All
runners.owner: Keith F J Loads & Harry Redknapp
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles but bumped into a big improver when well-held second of four at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) last month; upped in trip here and could still have a bigger run in him.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with two respectable runs and continues to slip down the weights; a possible
runners.name: Raffles Nobu
runners.spotlight: Just 1-14 over hurdles but hasn't been with current stable long and significant positives can be taken from last two runs (2m/1m7f); not yet proven over this far but continues to slip down the weights; a possible.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Lonray
runners.comment: Ran well when fourth on recent handicap debut (2m3f); one to consider
runners.name: Luwdvig
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles but ran well until weakening into fourth on recent handicap debut at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) and should be fine on the forecast slower ground here; one to consider.

14:50.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Has hinted at ability; goes handicapping off lowly mark and may well improve for new trip
runners.name: Directly
runners.spotlight: Some promise on bumper debut; down the field in three novice and maiden hurdles, latterly at Ascot and Cheltenham, but his chance is much more obvious now handicapping off a modest mark over a trip that he's bred to stay.

runners.comment: Won last 2, streets clear latest (3m1f); lesser stamina test now; respected under penalty
runners.name: Bollin Thou
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced for previous yards but events have taken a new turn for this one, improving to win at Uttoxeter (about 2m7f, good to soft) and streets clear at Hereford (extended 3m1f, soft) last week; lesser stamina test today but due a hefty rise in future so good chance of defying a penalty.

runners.comment: Runner-up in Irish point; modest hurdle form so far but a likely improver for handicaps
runners.name: Mild Magic
runners.spotlight: Made favourite before runner-up in Irish point last April; has not achieved much in maiden and novice hurdles at about 2m1f but this trip and level look likely to see her to much better advantage; market can guide.

runners.comment: Two good efforts over 2m in November; below that level since; has a trip query over 2m3f
runners.name: Inion Tiogair
runners.spotlight: In good form in November, going down only narrowly at Doncaster (2m, good to soft), but below that level since and is now 0-14 over hurdles; has a trip query back up in distance and has it to prove.

runners.comment: AW Flat winner at 1m; well held on handicap debut over 2m and not sure to want 2m3f
runners.name: Flagon Dry
runners.spotlight: AW Flat winner at 1m; in the frame in three juvenile hurdles in the autumn but was treading water when finishing remote on handicap debut at Windsor (2m, good) recently and the step up in trip has to be a query.

runners.comment: Maiden; big prices and well held in 2025; hard to foresee good run from out of weights
runners.name: Macs Xpress
runners.spotlight: Maiden who was big prices and well held throughout 2025; goes without regular headgear but hard to foresee a good run from out of the weights.

runners.comment: Runner-up to improved rival in two C&D handicaps; plenty more needed from out of weights
runners.name: Court One
runners.spotlight: Very modest form in qualifying runs; has chased home an improved rival in two C&D handicaps (good to soft) since but he's back to racing from well out of the weights again so plenty more needed.

15:20.race_name: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Point winner; chase win at 2m2f; runner-up over 2m4f latest; stamina to prove up in trip
runners.name: Koenigsstern
runners.spotlight: Won 3m point early in career but unraced beyond about 2m4f under rules and his chase win came over 2m2f (soft) last winter; returned to form when runner-up at Warwick (2m4f) 19 days ago but stamina remains an issue.

runners.comment: Ran well in 2m7f hurdle here in 2025; can improve on recent chase 3rd at Uttoxeter
runners.name: Better Off Alone
runners.spotlight: Ran well against a hotpot in 2m7f hurdle here last January; pulled up in first two chases but he wasn't  too far away in a better race at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy; first run since wind surgery) recently, where a couple of late mistakes spoiled an otherwise sound round of jumping; can improve with experience; first-time visor replaces cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Fair mark on best chase form in Britain but kept to hurdles in 2025; below best latest
runners.name: Icaque de LIsle
runners.spotlight: Sole chase win in France; not badly treated on past form over fences in Britain but he was kept to hurdles for the whole of 2025 and wasn't at his best on this track before Christmas; shade to prove for now.

runners.comment: Very lightly raced; respectable efforts of late but not yet looked a cast-iron stayer
runners.name: Thruthelookinglass
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced over the years; three respectable efforts in handicaps over hurdles and fences last year but has not yet proved himself a cast-iron stayer, having failed to find much when fourth at Huntingdon (2m7f, good to soft) in December.

runners.comment: Irish point winner; late mistakes cost him at Warwick (3m) but still has potential
runners.name: Star Of Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Beat a decent rival when winning Irish point; had some ups and downs over hurdles and fences in Britain but there was definite promise in his Warwick third (3m, soft) in December where late mistakes cost him behind two who have done well since; dropped 3lb; has potential for in-form yard.

runners.comment: Open to improvement on handicap hurdle/chase form but off since last spring; market useful
runners.name: Montmartin
runners.spotlight: Had just five runs in three years; promising handicap hurdle debut when runner-up at Southwell in April 2023 and he didn't do badly on his chase debut at Ffos Las (3m, good to soft) following two years off the track; has gone missing again since but a market move would be interesting.

runners.comment: Sole chase win at 2m5f but kept on well over 3m latest when runner-up to subsequent winner
runners.name: One Last Glance
runners.owner: Fred Camis Ray Fielder & Mel Clarke
runners.spotlight: Winner of 2m hurdle and 2m5f chase but stamina didn't seem to be lacking when keeping on after headed late at Wetherby (3m, soft) in December; has gone back up 3lb but the improving winner has gone in again since and this one could have more to come at this trip.

runners.comment: Three crushing defeats over fences for this yard and has lots to prove
runners.name: Givehimthehonour
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in 2022 but winless since and has suffered three crushing defeats over fences for this yard; has a lot to prove with refitted cheekpieces replacing a tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Strong C&D form includes a win last February; now 5lb lower; might revive back here
runners.name: Felton Bellevue
runners.owner: Mrs H Munn R E Good B Case
runners.spotlight: Four wins include one over C&D (soft) last February; has yet to be beaten more than about 5l on this track and although rather underpowered of late he might fare better back here off 5lb lower than latest win.

runners.comment: Has possibilities on staying hurdle form but chase efforts (0-4) don't compare as yet
runners.name: Endersen
runners.spotlight: Maiden who would come into it on his best staying hurdle form but his chase efforts don't compare, including when soundly beaten on the return to fences at Fontwell last time out.

15:50.race_name: At The Races App Expert Tips Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Rather mixed so far but close up when unseating 2 out (2m3f) latest in only his 2nd chase
runners.name: Desert Halo
runners.spotlight: Rather mixed but in the process of running well when unseating two out behind an improver in a Fontwell chase (2m3f, heavy) last month; this is only his third run over fences so still time for him to do better.

runners.comment: Belatedly off the mark at Plumpton (2m4f) last month following wind surgery; back up 7lb
runners.name: Lady Pretender
runners.spotlight: An early chase win looked imminent following two good 2m runs in late 2024 but some disappointments followed and it was only after a third wind surgery that she was off the mark quite readily at Plumpton (2m4f, good to soft; beat two rivals) latest; back up 7lb; good claims on that effort.

runners.comment: Multiple hurdle/chase wins, getting up on the line at Wincanton (2m4f) latest; close up
runners.name: Begin The Luck
runners.spotlight: Multiple hurdle and chase wins, the latest when rallying to lead late at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft; has won on soft and heavy) when beating one other finisher; back up 2lb but can continue a good run of form.

runners.comment: Hurdle promise last February but pulled up in two handicap chases this winter
runners.name: Jack The Nipper
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in his second hurdle start, at Sandown last February, but he's been pulled up in both handicap chases (2m4f and 3m) this winter; shaky claims for now.

runners.comment: Broke hurdle duck in late 2024 but not yet looked a natural chaser in two recent attempts
runners.name: Jackeline
runners.spotlight: Consistent since breaking hurdle duck in late 2024 but not yet looked a natural chaser in two attempts, over 2m6f (good to firm) and 2m2f (good to soft); needs first-time headgear to make a big difference.

runners.breeder: Haras De LEtoile & A S Gabrielle
runners.comment: Two chase wins (2m, good) last spring; soundly beaten then pulled up for new yard
runners.name: Gwennie May Jem
runners.spotlight: Won two chases (both at 2m on good ground) last spring for Dan Skelton but soundly beaten then pulled up in two runs for new yard; has run well on soft but likely of more interest when the ground dries out.

runners.comment: Promising chase debut (good); lesser effort since; this trip on soft may not be ideal
runners.name: Diamond Days
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles and fences; has run well on heavy ground (over 2m) but he didn't repeat a promising chase debut on this course (2m4f, good) in November when returned to a testing surface in December; still has to prove that 2m4f on soft is what he needs.

runners.comment: Won first two chase starts (2m4f) but pulled up next 2 starts and finished remote latest
runners.name: Stardhem
runners.spotlight: Fine start to chase career when winning two 2m4f handicaps at Huntingdon (good to soft and good) last spring but was pulled up on next two starts and finished remote back at Huntingdon (refitted cheekpieces; first-time blinkers today) in November; seems to have gone off the rails.

runners.comment: Minor form in points and over hurdles, including on handicap debut (50-1); chase debut
runners.name: Arctic Stream
runners.spotlight: Minor form in points and over hurdles so far, pulling up a long way out on her handicap debut at Windsor (50-1) in November; goes chasing with a lot to find; cheekpieces fitted.

runners.comment: Two 2m6f wins (soft/heavy) last winter; below best last twice; return to soft will suit
runners.name: Ronnies Reflection
runners.spotlight: Best form so far at up to about 2m6f, winning twice over that trip at Leicester (soft and heavy) last winter; wasn't quite on his game there two starts ago but had a stamina excuse over 3m2f since; at least the ground conditions will suit; not dismissed.

runners.comment: Hurdle winner before absence; creditable 2nd over C&D latest to one on a hat-trick
runners.name: Constant Friday
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner off a much higher mark before a long absence; it's been a long road back but he didn't give up the ghost over C&D (good to soft) last time against one on a hat-trick; entitled to go well again.

runners.comment: Chased home a subsequent winner at Wolverhampton last time; player from same mark
runners.name: Apache Green
runners.spotlight: 0-9 in handicaps since joining this yard, but a much better effort when chasing home a subsequent winner at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) 13 days ago; a player from the same mark.

runners.comment: Just beaten by an in-form rival at Lingfield nine days ago; high on the list off same mark
runners.name: Super Hit
runners.spotlight: Dual Chelmsford Polytrack winner who has been placed in five of his last eight starts, including when beaten half a length by an in-form rival from this mark at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) nine days ago; runner-up in two of his three runs over C&D and high on the list.

runners.comment: Has been out of form for a while and still to convince over this far
runners.name: Token Gesture
runners.spotlight: Just 1lb higher than when making a successful nursery debut here (7f) in September 2024, but has been out of form for a while and has still to convince over this far.

runners.comment: Recent form has been patchy and is 1-18 on AW; others more compelling
runners.name: Equion
runners.spotlight: 6lb below his last winning mark but recent form has been patchy, his narrow defeat at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last month surrounded by lesser efforts at the same track; 1-18 on AW; others more compelling.

runners.comment: 1-13 for Jim Bolger; makes her stable debut after three months off; market to guide
runners.name: Purple Sky
runners.spotlight: 1-13 for Jim Bolger when rather more out than in, and she certainly didn't shine in one go on Polytrack; makes her stable debut after three months off having changed hands for 2,000gns in October; market to guide.

runners.comment: Has dropped to a favourable mark but needs to improve on last two efforts
runners.name: Mbappe
runners.spotlight: All three wins in 2024 including one here (7f); 4lb lower than when third of 13 over that same trip back here in September and does stay this far, but his two efforts since raise doubts.

runners.comment: Most effective when able to dominate; dangerous if allowed his own way; has won over C&D
runners.name: Villalobos
runners.spotlight: Most effective when able to dominate as he again showed when making all at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) last month; given no peace up front there last time and now 7lb higher than for the win, but dangerous if allowed his own way and does have winning form over C&D.

runners.comment: 0-8 under rules for three different stables; hard to recommend
runners.name: Hopjes
runners.spotlight: 0-8 under rules for three different stables and seventh of ten on AW debut here (1m3f) 12 days ago; hard to recommend.

13:38.race_name: Try Unibet's Same Race Multi Handicap

runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick off 4lb higher; high on list with Oisin Murphy doing the steering
runners.name: Magna
runners.spotlight: Took 15 attempts to get off the mark, but now bids for a hat-trick after wins over C&D last month and at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) 15 days ago, where she just got the better of a dual subsequent winner; up another 4lb but still high on list with Oisin Murphy doing the steering.

runners.comment: 0-10 but 3lb lower than when second of 12 over C&D in September; in the mix
runners.name: Respectable Jack
runners.spotlight: 0-10, but 3lb lower than when second of 12 over C&D in September and a repeat of that performance would put him right in the mix; cheekpieces removed after one use.

runners.comment: Won twice over C&D last year and back off the same mark as for the latest in October
runners.name: Smasher
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last year and back off the same mark as for the latest in October; respected, especially if getting a solid pace to aim at.

runners.comment: Recent form has been patchy and just 1-18; others preferred
runners.name: Horus
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when fourth of 12 in this headgear combination at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) last month, but not so good at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) last time and just 1-18; others preferred.

runners.comment: Has regressed badly in his last five starts; best watched
runners.name: Conquest Of Power
runners.spotlight: Won at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) and Newcastle (6f, Tapeta) last February, but has regressed badly in five starts since with a second wind operation making no difference; best watched.

runners.comment: Well treated on his best form, but is now 0-17 and not quite sure what to expect
runners.name: Dr Ali
runners.spotlight: Well treated on his best form as when second of 14 off 4lb higher at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) in October, but is now 0-17 and not quite sure what to expect; cheekpieces return.

runners.comment: Unplaced in nine starts over 5f-8.6f; blinkers on
runners.name: Straight Back Up
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in nine starts over 5f-8.6f; blinkers need to make a difference (has worn a hood and cheekpieces).

runners.comment: Unplaced in all nine completed starts; look elsewhere
runners.name: Miraflores
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all nine completed starts, with her fourth of nine at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) last month starting to look a flash in the pan; look elsewhere.

14:08.race_name: Bet £20 Get £20 With Unibet Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Little encouragement in two starts over 1m on Polytrack; major improvement needed
runners.name: Al Amirah
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and little encouragement in two starts over 1m on Polytrack; major improvement needed upped in trip and can be handicapped after this.

runners.comment: Stable gets plenty of 3yo winners first time and market confidence should be heeded
runners.name: Distorted Truth
runners.spotlight: Sister to 1m/1m2f winner Westernesse (including AW; RPR 95); dam 1m2f winner (91), half-sister to 6f Group 3 winner Only Mine (dam of Listed-placed 1m6f-2m6f winner Uxmal), out of 10.6f Listed winner; stable gets plenty of 3yo winners first time and market confidence should be heeded.

runners.comment: Worth a market check on debut, but her future may lie over hurdles
runners.name: Echo Valley
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 2m Flat winner (RPR 93), half-sister to winners Whimsy (1m2f-1m6f Flat/2m hurdle) and Damned Elusive (1m4f-2m), out of 1m4f winning half-sister to 2m Listed winner Ranch Hand; worth a market check on debut, but her future may lie over hurdles for jumps-orientated stable.

runners.comment: Well held on last month's Wolverhampton debut; needs to take a step forward
runners.name: Five Moons
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred, but well held on last month's Wolverhampton debut (9.5f, Tapeta); needs to take a step forward.

runners.breeder: Haras Des Pyrenees Guy Pariente Holding
runners.comment: Plenty to like on breeding and stable has plenty of 3yo winners first time
runners.name: Galistra
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to French 10.5f winner Miss Incognito; dam placed French 1m, half-sister to winners Sosie (1m1f-1m4f Group 1), Uther (10.5f Group 3), Anasia (1m2f Listed) and Copie (7f Listed); plenty to like on breeding and stable has plenty of 3yo winners first time; market revealing.

runners.comment: 1,200gns 2yo; decent pedigree but stable not known for winning newcomers
runners.name: Glamerous
runners.spotlight: 1,200gns 2yo; dam 7f turf 2yo/9.5f AW Listed winner (RPR 103), closely related to winners Regardez (1m2f Listed) and Sightline (1m2f), half-sister to 15.5f Group 1 winner Scope, out of 7f/1m winning half-sister to Oaks winner Look Here; decent pedigree but stable not known for winning newcomers.

runners.comment: Green on debut, but should improve and the longer trip should suit on pedigree
runners.name: Helga
runners.spotlight: Green when eighth of 14 on last month's Southwell debut (7f, Tapeta); needs to improve, but that is possible especially as the longer trip should suit on pedigree.

runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Promising fourth on Dundalk debut, but longer trip is a doubt on pedigree
runners.name: Misty Cove
runners.spotlight: 28-1 when a staying-on fourth of 12 on last month's Dundalk debut (1m, Polytrack); open to progress, but her pedigree doesn't shout middle distances.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in two starts on AW; makes no appeal up in trip
runners.name: Peas And Queues
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in two starts over 6f/7f on AW; blinkers removed after one use; makes no appeal up in trip.

14:38.race_name: Unibet 40,000+ Live Streamed Events Novice Stakes (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Beat Caliban by a neck last month; may struggle to confirm the form under a penalty
runners.name: Siouxfonic
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who has transferred that ability to the Flat, going down by a neck at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) in November before going one better at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) five weeks ago; only had a neck to spare over Caliban, though, so may struggle to confirm the form under penalty.

runners.comment: Faced an impossible task on Flat debut on this track last month; plenty to find here too
runners.name: Lion City
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who faced an impossible task on Flat debut in a Listed race on this track (1m4f) last month and performed accordingly; has plenty to find here too.

runners.comment: Group 2-placed in Germany, but well beaten in two starts in the autumn; another new yard
runners.name: Abando
runners.spotlight: Group 2-placed in Germany, but well beaten in two starts on the AW for Marco Botti in the autumn and makes his debut for another new yard after 102 days off (same owner); probably best watched unless attracting support; cheekpieces removed after one use; stable also runs John Galt.

runners.comment: Behind Siouxfonic the last twice, but weighted to reverse latest running with him
runners.name: Caliban
runners.spotlight: Less than 2l behind Siouxfonic when fourth of nine at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) in November and within a neck of him at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) last month; good chance of reversing the form with penalised rival.

runners.comment: Showed more on second start despite finishing last of three; still needs plenty more
runners.name: Imperial Decision
runners.spotlight: Both starts at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack), showing a lot more in cheekpieces on the second occasion despite finishing last of three; still needs plenty more, though.

runners.comment: Promise when fourth on his Wolverhampton debut, but finished well behind two of these
runners.name: John Galt
runners.spotlight: Looked green but showed some promise when fourth of 12 on his Wolverhampton debut (1m4f, Tapeta; 66-1) five weeks ago; should improve, but he has plenty of ground to make up on Siouxfonic and Caliban.

runners.comment: Well held in both starts late last year, finishing behind a few of these on both occasions
runners.name: Kings Cruiser
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in two Tapeta starts late last year, finishing behind a few of these on both occasions; may fare better once handicapped.

runners.comment: Has lost her way over jumps; plenty to prove on belated Flat debut
runners.name: Imperial Jade
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles, but has lost her way over jumps; plenty to prove on belated Flat debut.

runners.breeder: Mount Coote Estates & Mr F Karothy
runners.comment: Not without promise when third on her Chelmsford debut but will need to improve a fair bit
runners.name: Aethelthryth
runners.spotlight: Not without promise when third of five on her belated debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) in November, but she will need to improve a fair bit to win this.

runners.comment: Not seen since beating one home on her debut here in November 2024; hood given a go
runners.name: Summer Appeal
runners.spotlight: Not seen since beating one home on her debut here (1m) in November 2024; best watched for now; hood given a go.

15:08.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Only third in hat-trick bid last time but didn't enjoy a clear run; respected
runners.name: Up The Agenda
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, the last two at Newcastle (6f, Tapeta); enjoyed anything but a clear run when third of seven at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) last time and the winner didn't do the form any harm in a valuable handicap at Newcastle on Friday; respected.

runners.comment: Some ability last year; market should be revealing on stable debut after 131 days off
runners.name: Unionville
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in three starts over 5f/6f on turf for Jessica Harrington last year; sold for 12,000gns and gelded; half-brother to an AW winner and market should be revealing on stable debut after break.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in two starts since winning here, but has a bit to find with Up The Agenda
runners.name: Mighty Vega
runners.owner: D Macauliffe A Don & LDS Bloodstock
runners.spotlight: Narrowly made a winning return in a C&D novice in November and not beaten far in two nurseries aferwards, but he has a bit to find with Up The Agenda on latest running; tongue-tie is given a go.

runners.comment: Debut winner; gradually returning to form as when second last time; shouldn't be far away
runners.name: Space Bear
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive2 & Jonny Allison
runners.spotlight: Gradually returning to form as when best of the rest behind a thriving rival at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) 13 days ago; shouldn't be far away.

runners.comment: Made a promising debut when third here in August, but has gone backwards since
runners.name: Uniter
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when third of 11 here (1m) in August, but has gone backwards since and failed to beat a rival in both handicaps with headgear fitted; dropping in trip needs to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Regressive in three starts at Southwell; needs a resurgence on handicap/Polytrack debut
runners.name: Saxon Prince
runners.spotlight: Regressive in three starts at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) and needs a resurgence on handicap/Polytrack debut; tongue-tie removed after one use.

runners.comment: Not disgraced since winning a Yarmouth nursery, but still has stamina to prove
runners.name: Canyouhearthedrums
runners.spotlight: Successful nursery debut in a four-runner contest at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm; first-time tongue-tie) last July; not disgraced in three starts since without improving on it and still to prove she stays 6f.

15:38.race_name: Unibet Supports Safer Gambling Fillies' Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & G P Clarke
runners.comment: Two C&D wins last year, including this race; may have been freshened up by a break; chance
runners.name: Shallow
runners.spotlight: Made all to win this race 12 months ago off a 3lb lower mark; followed up over C&D one month later and also added a 6f handicap at Newmarket last July; ran well over 7f at York's Ebor meeting but two subsequent runs have been disappointing, including back over C&D in October; could have been freshened up by a break and she is a leading contender.

runners.comment: Good chance on best turf form in 2025; not fired on AW of late but back against own sex
runners.name: Cressida Wildes
runners.spotlight: Good chance on last season's best turf form; three AW runs this winter need bettering but dropping back to fillies' only company is in her favour.

runners.comment: Good 2nd at Southwell (6f) latest; dangerous with a repeat; connections run two here
runners.name: Your Love
runners.spotlight: Probably didn't have to improve to win an uncompetitive 6f novice at Southwell in November; good second in a Southwell handicap (6f) three weeks ago; one of two runners for connections.

runners.comment: Thriving this winter, winning four times (5f), but disappointing at Lingfield on Saturday
runners.name: Gogo Yubari
runners.spotlight: Won three times in a week earlier in the month (all 5f); fluffed the start at Lingfield five days ago but  busy spell looked to be catching up with her when disappointing at Lingfield on Saturday.

runners.comment: Made all in a 7f handicap at Lingfield 19 days ago; needs more here; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Handle With Care
runners.spotlight: Good record on AW and she recorded her second win when making all over 7f at Lingfield 19 days ago; this looks a stronger race and she will need more to defy a 2lb rise; cheekpieces now added.

runners.comment: Yet to win a handicap but last two runs haven't been without hope; not ruled out
runners.name: Searchingtheblues
runners.spotlight: Won her first two starts (both 7f; here on debut) but 0-6 since handicapping; her last two runs haven't been without hope though and she is dropping down the weights.

runners.comment: Won over C&D on this card last year; needs to bounce back from a quiet run 24 days ago
runners.name: Court Drive
runners.spotlight: Below par at Wolverhampton last time but she had finished second on her two previous starts; won over C&D on the corresponding card 12 months ago; others appeal more for win purposes though.

16:08.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.comment: Record in handicaps over C&D reads 142 and latest Southwell run franked; high on list
runners.name: Im Workin On It
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who made a successful handicap debut over C&D in August and was only beaten a neck back here in November; his latest second of nine at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) has been franked by the winner and high on list from the inside draw.

runners.comment: Much better than this in his time, but recent efforts leave him with plenty to prove
runners.name: Riot
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has been much better than this in his time; 3lb below last winning mark but recent efforts, including three for this yard, leave him with plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Ran well to finish third over C&D last month; race has produced winners, but drawn widest
runners.name: Lerwick
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 16 but much better when third of 12 over C&D last month; that race has produced winners since and he races off the same mark, but the outside stall presents a problem; blinkers return.

runners.comment: Finished last on handicap debut over C&D after 328 days off; best watched
runners.name: Kev
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who was beaten a neck in a Wolverhampton maiden (8.6f, Tapeta) at the end of 2024, but finished last on handicap debut over C&D last month after 328 days off (Lerwick third); best watched.

runners.comment: Back off last winning mark but needs to put her latest efforts behind her
runners.name: Party Bear
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 7f on Tapeta last spring and back off the same mark as for the latest, but needs to put latest efforts behind her, including on return from six months off at Southwell recently; cheekpieces given a go.

runners.comment: 0-6 but has shown ability; longer trip shouldn't be an issue, but she has been off 80 days
runners.name: Neyvas Angel
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but has shown ability, as when fourth of 11 at Newmarket (5f, good) in October; this longer trip shouldn't be an issue on breeding, but she has been off for 80 days.

runners.comment: C&D winner; only just behind I'm Workin On It at Southwell last month; each-way claims
runners.name: King David
runners.spotlight: 0-11 since winning over C&D in September 2024, but was only just behind I'm Workin On It when third of nine at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) last month and again holds each-way claims.

runners.comment: Precious little to write home about in five handicaps; eyeshield on
runners.name: Exposay
runners.spotlight: Won a Thirsk maiden (7f, good to soft) last July, but precious little to write home about in five handicaps since; eyeshield given a go this time, but has enough to prove and is drawn wide.

runners.comment: Has beaten a total of one rival in two starts since joining this yard; hood on
runners.name: Saturn Seven
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over 5f-7f on turf in Ireland but has beaten a total of one rival in two runs at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) for this yard; first-time hood and the return of a tongue-tie needs to make a big difference.

runners.comment: C&D winner, but losing run up to 19 and has plenty to prove after 13 months off
runners.name: Dayman
runners.spotlight: Two wins on the AW for David Loughnane as a 3yo included one over C&D, but losing run up to 19 and has plenty to prove after 13 months off.

runners.comment: Can front-run; all four wins over further, but could go well if left alone in front
runners.name: Danehill Star
runners.spotlight: Often a front-runner; all four wins over longer trips on the AW early last year though he finished third of eight over C&D 12 days ago, albeit well adrift of the first two; could go well if left alone in front.

17:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Out of sorts under both codes in last three runs and he's 0-10 on AW
runners.name: Galactic Glow
runners.spotlight: Five-time turf winner who scored off 2lb lower at Lingfield (1m2f, good to firm) in August but he's been out of sorts on the Flat and over hurdles in last three starts; has something to prove back in this sphere as he's 0-10 on AW; tongue-tie removed.

runners.comment: 0-11 but was placed here last time and this new trip looks worth exploring; interesting
runners.name: Eutropia
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but she's on a reduced mark and was a keeping-on third here (9.4f) last time, on her second run for current yard; that form has been well advertised by the first two since and this new trip looks worth exploring; interesting contender.

runners.comment: 4yo who was tailed off over hurdles last time and he needs a transformation back on Flat
runners.name: Tenadaay
runners.spotlight: 4yo maiden who has finished down the field in both handicaps (1m4f) and he hasn't achieved a great deal in two hurdle runs for current yard; still has low mileage but he needs a transformation back on the Flat.

runners.comment: Off the mark with a dominant display over C&D on Friday; big player again under penalty
runners.name: Ice Opera
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo who got off the mark at the 20th attempt when making all in a C&D classified event on Friday; has a penalty back in a handicap but that was a dominant display and she's still unexposed at this trip; key player.

runners.comment: 0-9 and was tailed off over C&D last time; plenty to prove after another break
runners.name: Staffordshire
runners.spotlight: Bounced back when fourth off a reduced mark here (9.4f) in September but he was tailed off over C&D in his final run last year; that took his record to 0-9 and he has something to prove after another break.

runners.comment: 0-8 but looks feasibly treated on best form and she's in the mix back in trip
runners.name: Blue Siam
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but was creditable third in a Newcastle handicap (1m4f, Tapeta) in October and she may have been stretched over 1m6f in last two runs; looks feasibly treated on her best form and she's in the mix back in trip.

runners.comment: Sole win was in December 2023 and was tailed off in final two runs last year; opposable
runners.name: Pomeriggio
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; only win was in a 7f claimer (AW) in December 2023 and she finished a tailed-off last in her final two runs (hurdle/Flat) last year; 2m may have been too far here last month but she needs a major revival back at this trip.

runners.comment: Didn't fire at Southwell latest but she was on the up before that; possibilities
runners.name: Late Claim
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Lingfield (1m5f, Polytrack) last month and was runner-up at Southwell (1m6f, Tapeta) next time; didn't shine back at that track 15 days ago but she's still lightly raced and has possibilities if she can bounce back.

runners.comment: 32-race maiden who was beaten 11l behind Ice Opera over C&D on Friday; passed over
runners.name: Rampant
runners.spotlight: 32-race maiden who has been well held in last five runs, including behind Ice Opera in a classified event over C&D on Friday; passed over.

18:00.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Classified Stakes

runners.comment: 0-24 on AW but was placed in classified event at Newcastle (1m) last Saturday; in the mix
runners.name: Al Baahy
runners.spotlight: 0-24 on AW but respectable efforts in last three starts, including when third behind an emphatic winner in classified event at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) last Saturday; should get a decent tow into this race; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Record of 1-29 but his win was in September and has claims if he can recapture that form
runners.name: Al Shabab
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-29 but his win was at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) in September; finished down the field in last three starts but he's been forced wide in last two runs and has possibilities if things go more to plan this time.

runners.comment: 20-race maiden who finished last of nine in classified event over C&D last Monday
runners.name: Bondi Man
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 20-race maiden who finished last of nine in a classified event over C&D last Monday; others preferred.

runners.comment: Slow starter who is not easy to predict but she didn't get much luck here (8.6f) last time
runners.name: Boujee Gold
runners.spotlight: Slow starter who is not easy to predict but she didn't get much luck in a handicap here (8.6f) last month; could be dangerous if she gets the breaks this time and she's not ruled out.

runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford during the summer but was tailed off when last seen in September
runners.name: Dors Delight
runners.spotlight: All 14 runs have been on AW; off the mark with 18-1 win at Chelmsford (1m2f classified) in August but was tailed off in her follow-up bid at Lingfield in September; more to prove after 118 days off.

runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Six-time course winner but she's been out of sorts in last five runs; passed over
runners.name: Port Noir
runners.spotlight: Six-time course winner (6f-9.4f), but her last success was 15 months ago and she's been out of sorts in last five runs; has plenty to prove and this looks tough on these terms.

runners.comment: Has struggled for current yard and he needs a major revival with cheekpieces added
runners.name: Racing Country
runners.spotlight: C&D winner two years ago but he's beaten a total of two rivals in six starts for new trainer following an absence; cheekpieces are now added and he needs a major revival.

runners.comment: In good form for current yard; strong finish to win at Southwell (1m) on Saturday
runners.name: Relevant Range
runners.spotlight: Nothing like the force of old but in excellent form in classified events for new yard at Southwell and Newcastle, coming home strongly to beat an in-form rival at the former track (1m) on Saturday; solid claims.

runners.comment: Returns after another absence but he's a C&D winner and needs checking in market
runners.name: Star Of St Louis
runners.spotlight: 9yo who reappeared after long absence with encouraging fifth on stable debut at Yarmouth (1m classified) in August; back on the sidelines since then but two of his wins have come at this track (8.6f/9.4f) and he needs checking in the market back on AW.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on Boxing Day but he's not matched that since and losing run is up to 21
runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.spotlight: Placed in a C&D handicap on Boxing Day but he's not matched that in two subsequent starts and losing run is now up to 21.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who hasn't finished closer than 8l to a winner; down the list
runners.name: Lady Margret
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who hasn't finished closer than 8l to a winner and was never involved on recent stable debut at Southwell (7f); now drops into a classified event but she needs to show more back up in trip.

runners.comment: Some good efforts since September but her form nosedived here last time and she's now 0-17
runners.name: Spinning Dancer
runners.spotlight: Several creditable efforts on AW since September but her form nosedived over C&D on Boxing Day and she's now 0-17; down the list.

18:30.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2026 Not 2006 Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB)

runners.comment: Gelded half-brother to six winners; makes a belated debut and is probably best watched
runners.name: Jubilee Time
runners.spotlight: Gelded half-brother to six winners including Tanfantic (6f 2yo including AW; RPR 86) and Brooklyn Boy (1m3f/1m4f AW; 83); dam 6.5f winner, half-sister to 5f Group 2 winner Land Of Dreams (dam of Dream Ahead); has good pedigree but is probably best watched on belated debut.

runners.comment: Well held in two AW runs last spring and has plenty to find on this drop to 6f
runners.name: Appetiser
runners.spotlight: Well held in two AW maidens (7f) last spring, with RPRs in the 50s on both occasions; has plenty to find after 279 days off and she needs a transformation on this drop in trip.

runners.comment: 0-8 but he had a near miss at Lingfield last Monday; big player again; headgear switch
runners.name: Alasrae
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden but he's finished runner-up in three of his last five starts, including a near miss in a Lingfield novice (6f; first-time blinkers; visor today) last Monday; major player back on Tapeta for in-form yard.

runners.comment: Tailed off at 250-1 in three AW runs (6f-1m) since November
runners.name: Fuseboard
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at 250-1 in three AW runs (6f-1m) since November.

runners.comment: Has lots of stamina in pedigree but his sire was a sprinter; needs checking in market
runners.name: Lucky Sevens
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Arch My Boy (1m6f Flat, RPR 85; 2m hurdle), Break The Rules (1m4f AW, 76; 2m4f hurdle) and Princess T (1m2f-1m6f Flat in Jersey; 1m7f/2m hurdle); dam maiden (38); has lots of stamina in pedigree but his sire was a sprinter; needs market check.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D in November and he had an excuse from tough draw last time; respected
runners.name: Arishkas Dream
runners.spotlight: Left Chelmsford debut form behind when going close in C&D maiden in November; only fourth of ten on his return visit last month but he was forced wide and that was behind a useful prospect who made all; could resume progress if things go more to plan and he's respected.

runners.comment: Looks interesting on best form but she's now 0-7 and has been well held last twice
runners.name: Adalida
runners.spotlight: Looks interesting on her peak efforts for David Evans but she's been well below form in two novice events (6f/7f) for new yard this winter; record is now 0-7 and and she needs to bounce back near best.

runners.comment: Poor form in three 5f novice runs this winter including when tailed off here on Boxing Day
runners.name: Exhibition Match
runners.spotlight: Poor form in three 5f novice runs this winter including when tailed off here (200-1) on Boxing Day.

runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how she figures in market
runners.name: Coul Britannia
runners.spotlight: 18,000gns yearling; half-sister to 5f/7f 2yo winner Gray's Inn (RPR 88); dam unraced sister to Listed-placed 10.5f/1m4f winner Diyaraka, half-sister to 1m4f Group 2 winner Diamilina and Group 3 winners Diamond Green (7f 2yo) and Diamonixa (10.5f); plenty to like on paper and interesting to see how she figures in market.

19:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Best run for a while when 3rd at Newcastle last month; dangerous off the same mark
runners.name: Brave Empire
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
runners.spotlight: Best run for a while when third of 12 at Newcastle last month (6f); runs off the same mark and likely to give it another good go.

runners.comment: Chasing hat-trick after wins at Southwell and C&D; 4lb rise may not be enough to stop him
runners.name: Zoulu Warrior
runners.spotlight: Progressive sprinter who arrives here chasing a hat-trick after wins at Southwell and over C&D last month; up 4lb in a higher class but improvers are thin on the ground here and he holds strong claims.

runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage DYllone
runners.comment: Tumbled down the weights but hasn't looked like capitalising; enough to prove
runners.name: Wodao
runners.owner: Jim And Claire Ltd And Jon & Kay Collins
runners.spotlight: Has tumbled down the weights but without really looking like capitalising; tailed off at Chelmsford 17 days ago and has too much to prove.

runners.comment: C&D win in October came at Class 6 level; held twice since; others appeal more
runners.name: Lucky Man
runners.spotlight: Capitalised on the drop into Class 6 company when winning over C&D last October; came up short in Class 5 company twice afterwards and although he should be well treated on historical evidence, he may prove up against it back from 11 weeks off.

runners.comment: Hasn't lived up to market expectation in either run back from wind surgery; bit to prove
runners.name: Phoenix Of Dreams
runners.spotlight: Had a wind op prior to his return to action at Southwell last month but he didn't live up to his market billing; again well short of his best back at Southwell two weeks ago; has something to prove for now.

runners.comment: C&D win last November (Class 6); two respectable efforts have followed; needs more
runners.name: Addarella
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when winning a Class 6 over C&D last November; two respectable efforts have followed but she will need a step forward to take this now back against male opposition.

runners.comment: Veteran hold-up sprinter; needs to step up on last month's two runs
runners.name: Brian The Snail
runners.spotlight: Veteran hold-up sprinter; needs to step up on the form of two runs last month and might need a drop to Class 6 company before he is of serious interest.

runners.comment: Prominent racer; this mark is not beyond him but he'll have to defy the widest stall
runners.name: Early Release
runners.spotlight: Made all at Kempton in September (6f); went off too quickly when down the field behind Zoulu Warrior over C&D last month; missed an intended run at Southwell last week with the reason cited an admirably honest 'owner does not want to run from the draw' (fined £140); drawn widest here too.

runners.comment: Big eyecatcher over C&D last time; always reliant on luck but capable off this mark
runners.name: Water Of Leith
runners.owner: Adam Mills And Jonnie Delta Racing
runners.spotlight: His style of racing leaves him a hostage to fortune but, even so, his latest C&D run was eyecatching in the extreme (rider banned for ten days), dropped in from a wide draw and travelling powerfully but too far back to launch a menacing challenge; better drawn today and no doubt he's capable at this level if things pan out favourably.

runners.comment: Running well for new yard but this is a stronger race than he's been contesting; quirky
runners.name: Amerjeet
runners.spotlight: Three solid 5f efforts for his new stable and races as though the return to 6f should suit; he doesn't look the most straightforward though and has more to do upped in class.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: All six wins have been on AW and he's 4-5 over C&D; interesting contender on return
runners.name: Ash Wednesday
runners.spotlight: Won six times on AW between January and April last year; held on turf in final three runs last summer but his last win was off a similar mark to today's and he has a record of 4-5 over C&D; needs a close look back on Tapeta on his return.

runners.comment: Won over C&D in October and he had an excuse back here on Boxing Day; dangerous
runners.name: Hes A Gentleman
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in October before a good second at Southwell the following month; no impact after a slow start here on Boxing Day but that was against a pace bias and he still looks on a workable mark; dangerous if he can bounce back.

runners.comment: Returns after a break but she's unexposed and needs a close look on handicap debut
runners.name: Lodge
runners.spotlight: Won on Ffos Las debut (6f, good) in August and was a creditable second under a penalty at Windsor (6f, soft) the following month; returns after 140 days off but opening mark looks fair and she's an interesting contender upped in trip on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Made the breakthrough at Southwell in October but he didn't shine back there last time
runners.name: Star Of Mali
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough with a smooth win at Southwell (7f) in October but only sixth of 13 on return visit in November; has a bit to prove now but he's still lightly raced and is feasibly treated on his penultimate run.

runners.comment: Sole win was October 2023 but he's been knocking on the door recently; respected
runners.name: Arantes Nascimento
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in October 2023 but he had a near miss at Lingfield (7f, AW) last month and was runner-up at Chelmsford since; up another 1lb but he's been as good as ever recently and should make another bold bid.

runners.comment: In-form 9yo who completed a C&D double 17 days ago; strongly respected in hat-trick bid
runners.name: Chifa
runners.spotlight: In-form veteran who improved his AW record to 8-28 when completing a C&D double 17 days ago; 3lb higher here but he still looks on a workable mark and is tactically versatile; strongly respected in hat-trick bid.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but he's been well held the last twice and has tough draw here
runners.name: Beauty Choice
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who went close at Catterick (6f) in October but was well held on Tapeta (7f) in his final two runs last year; now 1lb lower than for his last win but he's drawn out wide and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Two 6f wins in the autumn and he has plenty of form at this trip; in the mix
runners.name: Vince Lombardi
runners.spotlight: 6f wins at Wolverhampton and Southwell in the autumn; runner-up twice since and he wasn't beaten far when favourite at Southwell (fifth of eighth) last time; now returns to 7f but he has plenty of form at this trip and he's in the mix.

runners.comment: Flopped in final two runs for Charlie Johnston and has plenty to prove for new yard
runners.name: Anthropologist
runners.spotlight: Two runner-up efforts on Tapeta (7f) in the autumn but tailed off in last two runs; left Charlie Johnston for 12,000gns in October; has plenty to prove for new yard and he needs a big turnaround; blinkers are removed and cheekpieces return.

20:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Easy 1m win at Lingfield last week; down in trip/penalised but still an obvious candidate
runners.name: Hardstyle
runners.spotlight: Failed to justify market support on his handicap debut here last month (8.6f) but still shaped quite well; made no mistake at Lingfield last week (1m), strong in the final furlong to win by 2.25l, and remains open to plenty more improvement; probably wouldn't want a tactical event dropped in trip but is still the one to beat.

runners.comment: Bred to be a bit better than this level; market to guide now up in trip for handicap debut
runners.name: Ganthorpe
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three novice sprint runs since debuting in November; makes his handicap debut at a modest level and the step up to 7f should help; bred to do better and the market can guide.

runners.comment: Presumably felt capable of better but hard to support on handicap efforts; new headgear
runners.name: Maynora
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to his market billing in two nursery runs last August; blinkered and returned to 6f for his return to action on New Year's Day (weak 14-1 shot) and couldn't go the pace, albeit behind a handicap blot; returns to 7f with new headgear tried.

runners.comment: Didn't progress for former yard and last of ten on debut for this one; best watched
runners.name: Resalah
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for Alice Haynes and she finished last of ten on her stable debut here (6f) three weeks ago; best watched.

runners.comment: Modest form to date but likely to do better at some point; betting to guide
runners.name: Electrocution
runners.spotlight: Yet to show much in his five starts and the handicapper has only dropped him 2lb for two seventh-place finishes in handicaps; likely to come good at some point; market to guide.

runners.comment: Modest RPRs in three starts but has left the impression there's more to come; interesting
runners.name: Backfire
runners.spotlight: Two runs for Peter Chapple-Hyam weren't without hope and she shaped better than the result on her stable debut over C&D four weeks ago; surprising if she weren't a good bit better than this mark now handicapping but Hardstyle will provide stiff opposition.

runners.comment: Possible improver upped in trip and switched to a low-grade handicap; gelded since latest
runners.name: Sorted
runners.spotlight: Only beat one rival home in three 6f runs last summer; gelded since; into more realistic company now and stepping up in trip can help.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs C Booth & Mrs S Cammidge
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer; poor form in three runs but bred to do better; betting to guide
runners.name: Fallacious Promise
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three novice/maiden runs at 6f (soft) and 7f (AW twice); bred to do better at some point and the betting is likely to guide as to whether it will be tonight.

runners.comment: 7f AW win as a 2yo but quiet since and she has the widest stall to contend with
runners.name: Miss Ayala
runners.spotlight: Made all to win a 7f nursery at Chelmsford last September; less good since and she has the widest stall to contend with this evening.

runners.comment: Latest effort (7f, Polytrack) was her best but this trip may prove too sharp
runners.name: Blue Mountains
runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly when fourth at Lingfield 12 days ago (7f) but was unable to threaten and may need a stiffer test kept to this trip.

runners.comment: Better known as a 6f performer but ran quite well over 5f recently (raced wide)
runners.name: Master Dandy
runners.spotlight: Much better known as a 6f performer but he ran quite well when fourth of six over 5f at Chelmsford recently, given he raced wide; has the inside stall and remains well handicapped; worth persisting with over this trip.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten over 7f last time and now 0-19; opposable back at 5f
runners.name: Mister McGregor
runners.spotlight: Posted a couple of respectable efforts in the autumn (7f/6f) but was soundly beaten on latest outing (7f) and is now 0-19; looks opposable back over 5f.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D on Friday, finishing second for the fourth time in a row; respected
runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.spotlight: Gained the last three of her seven wins over this C&D; runner-up four consecutive times since just before Christmas, most recently in very similar C&D race to this on Friday, and ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: Ran well when third over C&D on Friday but is 0-15 now; headgear switched
runners.name: Sultan Of Oj
runners.spotlight: Ran well from the front when third (just behind Colors Of Freedom) in first-time cheekpieces over C&D on Friday but is 0-15 now and needs to find something extra to open his account; visor tried today.

runners.comment: Absent since her three low-key 2yo runs for James Tate in autumn 2024
runners.name: Blue Dandy
runners.spotlight: Absent since her three low-key 2yo runs for James Tate in autumn 2024; makes stable/handicap debut at a lowly level and remains very unexposed but could be considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.comment: Won off much higher mark last spring but recent efforts have been very disappointing
runners.name: She Went Whoosh
runners.spotlight: Effectively 15lb lower than when scoring for Richard Hannon at Lingfield (5f) last April but recent efforts have been very disappointing.

runners.comment: 0-17; belied 50-1 odds when second over 6f recently but overall profile unconvincing
runners.name: Daley T
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden; belied 50-1 odds when staying on for second (no threat to clear winner) at Chelmsford (6f) 11 days ago but overall profile remains unconvincing.

runners.comment: Returned from break with respectable run on Wednesday; could have a say
runners.name: Rogue Endeavour
runners.spotlight: 0-20 now but had ground/trip excuses for his three below-par runs in September/October and returned from break with fairly respectable fourth of six in Lingfield classified on Wednesday; not out of this if that recent outing has brought him on.

runners.comment: Very well suited by this C&D but it's over a year since the latest of her ten wins
runners.name: Second Collection
runners.spotlight: Veteran mare; very well suited by this C&D but it's over a year since the latest of her ten wins and she was behind Colors Of Freedom when fourth in C&D classified this month.
